comment: Smart Data Models - MotionDeviceSystem schema adapted to DTDL from smartdatamodels.org. Source: https://raw.githubusercontent.com/smart-data-models/dataModel.OPCUA/master/MotionDeviceSystem/schema.json
description: MotionDeviceSystem provides a representation of a motion device system as an entry point to the OPC UA device set. This instance organises the information model of a complete robotics system using instances of the described ObjectTypes. A motion device system may consist of multiple motion devices, controllers and safety systems.

contents.name: alternateName
contents.comment: An alternative name for this item

contents.name: areaServed
contents.comment: The geographic area where a service or offered item is provided

contents.name: dataProvider
contents.comment: A sequence of characters identifying the provider of the harmonised data entity.

contents.name: dateCreated
contents.comment: Entity creation timestamp. This will usually be allocated by the storage platform.

contents.name: dateModified
contents.comment: Timestamp of the last modification of the entity. This will usually be allocated by the storage platform.

contents.name: source
contents.comment: A sequence of characters giving the original source of the entity data as a URL. Recommended to be the fully qualified domain name of the source provider, or the URL to the source object.

contents.name: controllers
contents.comment: Controllers is a container for one or more instances of the ControllerType. Controller represents a controlling unit of one or more motion devices. A controller can be e.g. a specific control cabinet or a PLC.

contents.name: motionDevices
contents.comment: MotionDevices is a container for one or more instances of the MotionDeviceType. A motion device has as least one axis and is a multifunctional manipulator designed to move material, parts, tools or specialized devices through variable programmed motions for the performance of a variety of tasks. Examples are an industrial robot, positioner or mobile platform.

contents.name: owner
contents.comment: A List containing a JSON encoded sequence of characters referencing the unique Ids of the owner(s)
